column4: we have wifi. i do not want the students to see the wpa key. how should i do?
i just want to avoid the students to click and see the key to copy it and use their smartphones
cause if i right click properties under gnome, i can see everything.
they should use these computers.
i know, i d just like for them not be able to see the key
mmmmm yes they can
once they re connected,
they can just right click and see the wpa key
that s it. i don t want them to COPY the key for other devices
is there a way?
there should be, im not sure if wicd does it
gnome stores it, it doesn't give it out
right click and you see it
yes but you're on the network, it stores the key for it
hmm
they can't connect without the key
ok:
does the wicd connection manager show the key?
i don t use it right now: they just have to run the default one, ... easy trick
yes but if you remove the default one and use wicd
ok listen to llutz_
